page.title: 03Wendover News 1985
page.content: Wendover Parish Council has spent 25,000 pounds on refurbishing the central Clock Tower building. This is now a Tourist Information Centre and Committee Room. Parishioners and local residents raised over 30,000 pounds in order to convert part of St.Mary's Church into a community centre. Project '83 has resulted in a fine reconstrution known as St.Mary's Centre, which is well patronised. Pebble Brook School is shortly to be extended in preparation for its new use- a school for maladjusted boys. The building of a new Youth Centre is well under way, sighted within the campus of the 3 schools. Consideration is being given to market traders' site rent. Wendover Middle School has received much public acclaim and press coverage through its involvement in the BBC Domesday Project 1985/6.
